betaOverlay.text: This feature is still in beta
betaOverlay.tooltip: This feature is still in beta, and may change with future updates

betaSettingTooltip: This setting is still in beta and may change with future updates.

chatHighlightOverlay.Instructions: This overlay will show when you select a message with the chat overlay

chatOverlay.FitBrowserWindowTooltip: In case you use chat in a browser and want it to be full sized, turn this on
chatOverlay.SetupInstruction: Setup streaming credentials on the streaming settings page
chatOverlay.HideMessagesEnabledTooltip: Enabling will hide messages in the chat overlay after a specific amount of time. This can be useful if you dont want one message to stay up in your overlay for long time due to lack of chat activity for example.
chatOverlay.HideMessagesAfterSecondsTooltip: Amount of seconds to hide the message

ControlCommandsTooltips.BoostMe: Subscribers can use a boost 1 time / day to give their car a bit of a boost
ControlCommandsTooltips.ChatRacingHelp: Available commantds for the users to show for guidance
ControlCommandsTooltips.ClearRace: Removes the game overlay from the screen.
ControlCommandsTooltips.FinishRace: Forces to finish the game (if you don't want to wait for everyone)
ControlCommandsTooltips.JoinRace: Let players to join the race using the command
ControlCommandsTooltips.MyRating: Informs the player about how much MyRating he has.
ControlCommandsTooltips.NewRace: Starts a new race for the viewers to be able to start joining to it.
ControlCommandsTooltips.StartRace: Starts the new race, players can race right after this command.

chatRaceOverlay.SetupInstructions: Setup streaming credentials on the streaming settings page
chatRaceOverlay.resetGameDataNotificationText: Your chat race player scores has been reset

commonSettings.HideInGarageTooltip: Hides the overlay when you are not sitting in the car
commonSettings.OnlyShowInGarageTooltip: Shows the overlay only when you are not sitting in the car (staying in garage)
commonSettings.RenderFPSTooltip: Changes the rate of how often the overlay gets updated. Setting high values can have big impact on the CPU and GPU usage
commonSettings.ShowLapsCompletedOnTireCompounds: Show laps completed in tire compounds
commonSettings.ShowOutLapTooltip: Showing the 'OUT' flag when car is on an out lap. The out lap is the first lap after the driver leaves the pit stop. This lap is usually a slow lap and is used to get the tires and brakes up to the right temperature before the driver performs his hot lap.
commonSettings.driverTagInstructions:
Using driver tags lets you add tags to different drivers (dirty driver tag, clean driver tag, etc..). With driver tags you no longer need to remember anyone's name. Just set some tags on drives after races and the next time you'll see them, the tags will show up next to their names.
You can set driver tags on the following link

customTextOverlay.ScrollTextSpeedTooltip: The amount of time the full text completes one round in seconds. Example: 1s = very fast, 20s = normal speed, 40s = slow
customTextOverlay.TextTooltip: Place any text into the input field that you want to appear in the overlay

customUrlOverlay.UrlTooltip: Place any url into the url input field to show a custom image, a custom overlay or anything you like to show in this overlay

dataBlocksOverlay.ScrollTextSpeedTooltip: The amount of time the full text completes one round in seconds. Example: 1s = very fast, 20s = normal speed, 40s = slow

flagsOverlay.OverlayInfoHint: On the first setup, go in a practice session and run through the pit over the speed limit. This will trigger the black flag to show so you can see and place it somewhere on your screen.

fuelCalculator.InformationContent1: Refueling strategies are here to help you better understand your fuel consumption during a race.
fuelCalculator.InformationContent2: You can have an eye on several fuel consumption metrics, such as average fuel consumption(per lap) or last 5 average, highest fuel consumption, and so on.
fuelCalculator.InformationContent3: These 'strategies' are measuring your fuel consumption on a single lap, to then be able to calculate your overall fuel usage for the entire race. It then can determine if you need to refuel, or if you are safe to finish the race without extra fuel.
fuelCalculator.RefuelingCanOnlyBeSelectedOnce: Refueling strategy can only be selected once, which is a global setting for the fuel calculator.
fuelCalculator.RefuelingChooseYourStrategyOnMasterPage: Please choose your strategy in the fuelcalculator overlay settings page:
fuelCalculator.ShowAllLapsAverageTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on the average of all laps in the session
fuelCalculator.ShowFuelWindowBarTooltip: FuelWindow bar shows you the upcoming laps for your race. Each bar represents one lap. Green bars are representing opportunity to refuel on your race. Orange bar is representing your current lap.
fuelCalculator.ShowFuelWindowStatusTooltip: Fuel window status is based on the refueling strategy. We show the fuel window and it's status based on what the current refueling strategy is.
fuelCalculator.ShowHighestLapTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on the lap that had the highest fuel consumption in the session
fuelCalculator.ShowLast5AverageTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on averaging the lap 5 lap fuel consumption in the session
fuelCalculator.ShowLast10AverageTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on averaging the lap 10 lap fuel consumption in the session
fuelCalculator.ShowLastLapTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on the last lap in the session
fuelCalculator.ShowLowestLapTooltip: Calculates fuel consumption based on the lap that had the lowest fuel consumption in the session
fuelCalculator.resetFuelConsumptionHelpTitle: Fuel consumption is cached after a race to provide you a better experience for the upcoming races. In rare cases you might need to reset this cache. If the calculation is incorrect and you get incorrect fuel calculations, this might be a good option to try.
fuelCalculator.resetFuelConsumptionNotificationText: Your fuel consumption cache is now cleared.
fuelCalculator.EnableFuelSharingTooltip: Enable the fuel sharing feature if you want to let your teamates to see detailed information about your fuel status

main.title: fuel sharing
main.guide: If someone has given you a token, then click join group and paste the token in. If you want to create your own group, click create group and share your own token with your team mates.

joinGroup.title: join a fuel sharing group
joinGroup.guide: To join a fuel sharing group, please enter a token that somebody created.

joinedGroup.title: fuel sharing group
joinedGroup.guide: You’ve made a fuel sharing group: now you can see the information of any members who have joined by spectating them with your fuel overlay open

errorMessages.fuelTokenError: We could not create a new fuel sharing token. Please try again or contact Racelab support if the error persist
errorMessages.joinGroupError: OOPS: That's not a valid token. Please double check it and try again
errorMessages.leaveGroupError: We could not remove you from the group. Please try again or contact Racelab support if the error persist
errorMessages.loadGroupMembersError: We could not load group members. Please try again and if the issue persist please contact Racelab support
errorMessages.unknownError: Something went wrong. Please try again or contact Racelab support if the error persist.

tokenCopied.title: Copy to clipboard
tokenCopied.text: Your fuel token was copied to your clipboard.

fuelCalculator.ShowTimeRemainingUntilEmptyHelpTitle: Showing your fuel level translated in time. It gives you a precise indication of how long your fuel tank will last in terms of minutes and seconds.
fuelCalculator.ShowTimeRemainingUntilEmptyTargetHelpTit: Shows if you have additional fuel or negative amount of fuel before the session ends. Positive value means that you have surplus 'time' in your tank, negative value means you will run out of fuel before the session ends.

horizontalStandings.ViewTypeTooltip: Changed the way drivers will show on the overlay

inputTelemetryOverlay.ComparisonOptionPersonalBestLapInfo: Your best laptime telemetry will be showed as a reference.
inputTelemetryOverlay.ComparisonOptionPersonalBestOfFriendsInf: The best laptime telemetry of your friends (including you) will be showed as a reference. You will be sharing your telemetry only with your friends, and you will only get telemetry from people who added you as friend in RaceLab.
inputTelemetryOverlay.ComparisonOptionPersonalBestOfFriendsLoc: To manage your friends, please go to the friends settings page:
inputTelemetryOverlay.ComparisonOptionPersonalLastLapInfo: Your last laptime telemetry will be showed as a reference.
inputTelemetryOverlay.TelemetryComparisonInfoPositionTooltip: Choose where the comparison should show on the overlay
inputTelemetryOverlay.TelemetryComparisonReferenceTooltip: Choose what should be the comparison for your telemetry. You can choose to compare your current telemetry with your last lap, with your best lap, or the best lap of one of your friend
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeTooltip: Changes the mode of how the speed comparison is drawn to the telemetry graph
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeInfo:
Speed comparison behaves differently than pedal inputs. The speed between two laps usually are very similar. If you compare two speed telemetry, they will get very close to each other, making it harder to see the difference.
Luckily if you want greater insights into the speed differencies, you can choose a different mode to highlight these differencies.
Select one comparison mode to know more of each option.
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeFullRangeInf: this is the default setting, in this mode the minimum speed on the graph is 0, and the maximum speed is the maximum achieved speed on the track. Might be harded to spot subtle differencies in this mode.
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeScopedRangeI:
In this mode the minimum and maximum speed are dynamically changing on the graph, trying to 'zoom in' to the actual comparison that is being shown and maximize the visual differencies as much as possible. 
Easier to spot differencies but it can be confusing for some to use.
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeOpponentDiff: in this mode your speed will be fixed on a horizontal line and we only show the difference of your comparison reference speed. (going above the horizontal line means the comparison reference achieved higher speed, going under the horizontal line means the comparison reference achieved lower speed)
inputTelemetryOverlay.SpeedComparisonTelemetryModeDriverDiffIn: in this mode your comparison reference speed will be fixed on a horizontal line and we only show the difference of your speed. (going above the horizontal line means you achieved higher speed, going under the horizontal line means you achieved lower speed)

lapTimeGraphOverlay.FilterOutHigherTooltip: Filtering out values that are lower than your overall median lap time + x seconds (the value you provide)
lapTimeGraphOverlay.FilterOutLowerTooltip: Filtering out values that are higher than your overall median lap time + x seconds (the value you provide)
lapTimeGraphOverlay.IsFilterOnTooltip: Use LapTime filters to filter out lap times you don't want to see in the graph. Typically useful to filter out first laps, laps with pitting, out laps. In case you want to see consistency in your laptimes, you don't want to see unrelevant laptimes like the ones mentioned before.
lapTimeGraphOverlay.LimitLapCountTooltip: Enabling it will limit the number of laps shown in the overlay

lapTimeLogOverlay.RowCountTooltip: Limits the number of lines shown on the overlay
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowFriendBestModeDeltaTooltip: Enabling it will show a delta column for comparison
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowFriendBestModeTooltip: Showing the all time best laptime of your friends
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowLapTimeGraphTooltip: Enabling it will show a graphical representation of your lap times
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowPersonalBestModeDeltaTooltip: Enabling it will show a delta column for comparison
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowPersonalBestModeTooltip: Showing the all time best lap time you did on the track
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowPersonalSessionBestModeDeltaTooltip: Enabling it will show a delta column for comparison
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowPersonalSessionBestModeTooltip: Showing the best lap time you did in the current session
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowReverseOrderTooltip: Lap times are populating top to bottom by default. Reversing it will populate bottom to top instead
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowSessionBestModeDeltaTooltip: Enabling it will show a delta column for comparison
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowSessionBestModeTooltip: Showing the session best lap time ( any drivers who set the fastest laptime in the session will set this time )
lapTimeLogOverlay.ShowTempInComparisonTooltip: Enabling it will show track temperature in the comparison view

masterOverlay.text: This is your Master Overlay config
masterOverlay.tooltip: If you're using layouts, you can use your master overlay settings instead of configuring the overlay settings over and over again. This is your master overlay setting. The changes you make here will affect your layout if it's set to use your master overlay setting.

micVisualizerOverlay.BarOpacityTooltip: Bar opacity can only be adjusted when 'Led Bars' are turned off
micVisualizerOverlay.SetupInstruction: If you are using this overlay in a browser source in OBS then you MUST start obs with this argument:
micVisualizerOverlay.SetupInstruction2: Or simply right click on your OBS desktop shortcut -> Properties, and paste {{param}} at the end of the Shortcut -> Target field. You should end up something like the following:

pitboxHelperOverlay.PitBoxDetectionRangeTooltip: The range of the pit stall detection distance in meters. Defining when the pit stall distance indicator will start progressing from the given distance.

proOnlyFeatureTooltip: This is a Pro Membership only feature

relativeOverlay.ReferenceCarBackgroundColorHelpTitle: Set the background color of the reference driver
relativeOverlay.ReferenceCarStripeColorHelpTitle: Set the stripe color of the reference driver

standingsOverlay.HideLastLapAfterSeconds: Hide last lap time after seconds
standingsOverlay.ReferenceCarBackgroundColorHelpTitle: Set the background color of the reference driver
standingsOverlay.ReferenceCarStripeColorHelpTitle: Set the stripe color of the reference driver
standingsOverlay.AlwaysShowLastLapTimeTooltip: Setting this to true will never hide the last laptime. Set it to false if you want last laptime to hide after a few seconds.

thisFeatureIsNotAvailableInSim: This feature is not available for {{sim}}

trackMapOverlay.FriendsInformationText: You can set up your friend list in the friends settings page:
trackMapOverlay.HighlightMyCarTooltip: This option will place a border around your car. Choose a custom color you like.
trackMapOverlay.HighlightMyFriendsCar: Highlight border of a friend's car
trackMapOverlay.HighlightMyFriendsCarTooltip: This option will place a border around your friend's car. Choose a custom color you like.
trackMapOverlay.OverwriteMyCarColorTooltip: This option will change your car color to the color you specify. Be aware that turning on this option will lose your class color and replace it to your chosen one.
trackMapOverlay.OverwriteMyFriendsCarColorTooltip: This option will change your friend's car color to the color you specify. Be aware that turning on this option will lose your class color and replace it to your chosen one.
trackMapOverlay.ShowCustomTrackColorTooltip: Setting this option true will let you change the track base color to your liking
trackMapOverlay.ShowSectorDeltaScopeTooltip: More options will come soon. For now you will always have a session-based comparison for your sector time markers.
trackMapOverlay.ShowSectorDeltaTooltip: Marks each sectors on the track with 'personal best' and 'session best' markers, increasing the visibility on your pace on the track
trackMapOverlay.ShowStartFinishLineTooltip: Turning this option on will mark you where the start/finish line is
trackMapOverlay.ShowTrackBorderTooltip: This option will draw border around the track. You can also choose the color of that border.
trackMapOverlay.ShowTurnNamesTooltip: Showing turn names for each turn of the track to easier identify which turn is which
trackMapOverlay.ShowTurnNumbersTooltip: Showing turn numbers for each turn of the track to easier idenify which turn is which
trackMapOverlay.StartFinishLineSizeTooltip: Set the  size of the start/finish line. This metric can never be lower than the track size.
trackMapOverlay.TrackPathWidthTooltip: Set the thickness of the track
trackMapOverlay.TurnNumberSizeTooltip: Set the size of the turn numbers and turn names
trackMapOverlay.WidthTooltip: Set the maximum width you want your trackmap to be. Width and height can change depending on the track, but you can set here the maximum allowed width for a track.

youCanSetTheColorOfThisValue: You can set the color of this value

zoomedOverlay.text: Preview is 60% smaller than the original
zoomedOverlay.tooltip: Due to the size of this overlay, you can see it in a zoomed-out view

blindSpotOverlay.distanceTooltip: Sets the distance between the two blind spot element
blindSpotOverlay.inactiveOpacityTooltip: Sets the opacity of the overlay when there is no cars around you. This can be helpful when you dont want the overlay to be so prominent when cars are not next to you.

radarBarsOverlay.inactiveOpacityTooltip: Sets the opacity of the overlay when there is no cars around you. This can be helpful when you dont want the overlay to be so prominent when it's not active
radarBarsOverlay.visibleDistanceInMTooltip: Sets the physical distance about how far ahead and behind you will see the cars in your radar
radarBarsOverlay.opponentCarHeightTooltip: Sets the size of the opponent car in the overlay
radarBarsOverlay.showClosestDistanceTooltip: When enabled, it shows the physical distance of the closest car ahead and behind you
radarBarsOverlay.colorClosestDistanceTooltip: When enabled, the distance indicator will have a background color indication, showing whether you get closer or further away from a car
radarBarsOverlay.barsDistanceTooltip: Sets the distance between the left and the right bars
radarBarsOverlay.barHeightTooltip: Sets the height of the bar overlay on your screen
radarBarsOverlay.barWidthTooltip: Sets the width of the bar overlay on your screen
radarBarsOverlay.selfCarHeightTooltip: Sets the height of the left and right detection zone on your screen

deltabar.liveDeltaModeTooltip: Choose what should be the reference lapTime that your delta overlay will be show the delta to
deltabar.backgroundIsStripedTooltip: Turning this option on will create striped background on the delta bar

laptiming.backgroundIsStripedTooltip: Turning this option on will create striped background

lapTimeSpreadOverlay.maximumCarsTooltip: Defines the maximum amount of cars shown on the overlay. In case there are more cars in the session, they will not be shown on the overlay
lapTimeSpreadOverlay.maximumSpreadInSecondsTooltip: Defines the maximum spread in seconds. Any lap time over this number will not be shown on the overlay

sessionTimerOverlay.ShowDynamicLapsOrTimeToolTip: Dynamic mode shows laptime in case the session is time based, and will show laps information in case the session is lap based

heartrateOverlay.showBpmTooltip: Showing the amount of heart rate per minute
heartrateOverlay.showCaloriesTooltip: Showing the amount of burned calories overall
heartrateOverlay.showPeakTooltip: Showing the highest heart rate measured since start
heartrateOverlay.showMatchedActivityTooltip: Showing similar activities that is matching to your current heart rate and calories consumption
